thread.title: Mets: Terry Collins' World Series trip fulfills a boyhood dream
thread.title_full: Mets: Terry Collins' World Series trip fulfills a boyhood dream

title: Mets: Terry Collins' World Series trip fulfills a boyhood dream
text:
ASSOCIATED PRESS Terry Collins waving to fans after returning to New York. 
As an 11-year-old, Terry Collins begged his mother to stay home so he could watch a World Series battle between the Yankees and Pirates in 1960. 
"She wrote me a note to get me out of school in the fifth grade so I could stay home," Collins recalled Wednesday night. Buy this photo 
Forty-five years later, after his team clinched a World Series berth with a sweep of the Cubs at Wrigley Field, Collins gets a chance to manage in one. 
"I’m sitting there thinking, holy crap, now you’re in after all these years," Collins said. "It was worth the wait." Buy this photo 
Collins, in his 11th season as a major league manager, has come a long way in his first trip to the postseason. He came close to a World Series as a Pirates bullpen coach in 1992, but Pittsburgh lost in the NLCS. 
"It’s a special moment for me," Collins said. "After all these years, when this has been your whole life, to finally get to the ultimate series every person that’s ever played this game wants to get to, let’s go home and enjoy it." 
FAMILIA LIGHTS OUT: Closer Jeurys Familia allowed just two hits in 4 1/3 innings in the NLCS, and has not surrendered a run in 9 2/3 innings in his first postseason. 
He recorded the final out in each of the four NLCS games, and recorded three saves. Buy this photo 
"That moment when I struck him out, got the [last] hitter, I just want to enjoy with my teammates," Familia said. "I know we’re going to the World Series, I just want to have fun with my teammates because we’re looking for this moment this year. Now it’s here. It’s something that I can’t believe, and I just enjoy this moment with my teammates." 
BRIEFS: The NLCS had its largest television audience since 2010, averaging 7.9 million viewers on TBS. … The Mets split four games with the Blue Jays this season. They did not face the Royals.
